page.title: 18NW.SHERBORNE:FARMING (2)
page.content: The main crops grown in the area are the cereal crops of{wheat and barley.} Both winter and spring crops are grown. Most of the farms use the tramline method of access to their crops for{spraying}although some aerial spraying is carried out towards the end of the growing season. The smaller farmers often employ {contractors}to harvest their crops. After the{harvest,}which can vary between mid-July and late August, the stubble is usually burnt off and large clouds of smoke can be seen across the countryside at this time. A small amount of oats and maize is also grown. Apart from cereal crops there are also fields of potatoes, turnips, are peas, but these only account for a small portion of the farmland. A few of the old{cider orchards}still remain but they are mostly run-down.
